answers.author: Julie Edmonds-Mares
answers.text:
The City of San Jose’s Anti-Graffiti Program utilizes data reported by residents, and collected by our graffiti eradication vendor, Graffiti Protective Coatings, Inc.  The primary means of reporting graffiti is through our smart phone app, San José Clean. Working with our graffiti eradication vendor, graffiti incidents are photographed, mapped, and categorized in a useful database. This database allows staff, including law enforcement, to easily track and analyze the graffiti activity.  Please feel free to contact the City of San Jose’s Anti-Graffiti Program at (408) 975-7233 or antigraffiti@sanjoseca.gov for more information.

author: Bobbi Lloyd
text: The City of Tempe is searching for information on how other cities quantify graffiti in their community in regard to tracking, measuring/charting the existing amount and condition assessment.  Do you do annual assessments?  If so, does it include only what can be seen from roadways?  We are looking beyond just a tracking report for how much graffiti is abated each year.  Any help you can provide would be greatly appreciated.  Please contact me for questions.
title: Graffiti
